content.webTitle: Nortel to restate three years' financial results

fields.headline: Nortel to restate three years' financial results
fields.bodyText: The Canadian telecoms group Nortel admitted yesterday that it would have to restate its financial results yet again after incorrectly booking revenues. Nortel, which is still the subject of a federal inquiry over its accounting, made a $2.5bn (£1.4bn) fourth-quarter loss after settling two class-action lawsuits over accounting errors. Nortel, which ousted its top executives two years ago over the scandal, said annual results for 2005 had been delayed by a month while it restated 2002-05 revenues. Mike Zafirovski, chief executive, said: "This revenue is real; it was recognised in the wrong periods."
